file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 38-32-09-04 - TOILET-UNIT MOTOR PUMP FILTER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TOILET-UNIT MOTOR PUMP FILTER - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the toilet-unit motor pump. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 38-32-09-000-801-A Toilet-Unit Motor Pump Filter ALL 38-32-09-400-801-A Toilet-Unit Motor Pump Filter EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 38-32-09 Page 1 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-09-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. Toilet-Unit Motor Pump Filter A. General WARNING: PREVENT CONTACT WITH THE LAVATORY FLUIDS DURING MAINTENANCE OR SERVICE IN THE LAVATORY AREA. • PUT ON SAFETY GOGGLES. • PUT ON SAFETY GLOVES. • PUT ON SAFETY CLOTHES. (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the toilet-unit motor pump filter. (2) The toilet-unit motor pump filter is installed on the toilet unit. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-801-A/300 - AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-802-A/300 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Goggles Protection for the eyes 1 available Commercially Rubber Gloves Protection for the hands 1 available Commercially Safety Clothes Prevent contact with the lavatory fluids 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Lavatory EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 38-32-09 Page 2 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 000-003-A (1) Remove the toilet shroud assembly ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400). SUBTASK 610-002-A (2) Make sure that the toilet unit is serviced (AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-801-A/300 or AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-802-A/300, as applicable) and empty. SUBTASK 862-002-A (3) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, open the FLUSH circuit breaker (Location tip: DC BUS 1/LAVATORY/FLUSH) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. J. Removal SUBTASK 000-002-A (Figure 401) (1) Remove the clamp (2) and hose (1) from the motor pump filter assembly (4). (2) Remove the clamp (2) and hose (3) from the anti-siphon tube of the motor pump filter assembly (4). (3) Remove the nut (10) and washer (9) that attaches the grounding strap (8) to the motor pump filter assembly (4). (4) Disconnect the timer water tank cable (11) from the motor pump filter assembly (4). (5) Remove the nuts (7) and washers (6) that attach the motor pump filter assembly (4) to the toilet assembly (REF.). (6) Remove the motor pump filter assembly (4). (7) Remove the gasket (5) from the motor pump filter assembly (4) and discard it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 38-32-09 Page 3 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Toilet-Unit Motor Pump - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE 262 B 11. TIMER WATER DET. A TANK CABLE 10. NUT 1. HOSE 9. WASHER 2. CLAMP (2) 8. GROUNDING STRAP 3. HOSE 7. NUT (7) 6. WASHER (7) 4. MOTOR PUMP FILTER ASSEMBLY TOILET ASSY (REF.) 5. GASKET DET. B MR145AMM380001B.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 38-32-09 Page 4 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-09-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. Toilet-Unit Motor Pump Filter A. General WARNING: PREVENT CONTACT WITH THE LAVATORY FLUIDS DURING MAINTENANCE OR SERVICE IN THE LAVATORY AREA. • PUT ON SAFETY GOGGLES. • PUT ON SAFETY GLOVES. • PUT ON SAFETY CLOTHES. (1) This task gives the procedures to install the toilet-unit motor pump filter. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-801-A/300 - AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-802-A/300 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Goggles Protection for the eyes 1 available Commercially Rubber Gloves Protection for the hands 1 available Commercially Safety Clothes Prevent contact with the lavatory fluids 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended Not Applicable I. Installation SUBTASK 420-002-A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 38-32-09 Page 5 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Install gasket (5) on the motor pump filter assembly (4). (2) Put the motor pump filter assembly (4) in its installation position. (3) Install the nuts (7) and washers (6) to attach the motor pump filter assembly (4) to the toilet assembly (REF.). (4) Install the nut (10) and washer (9) to attach the grounding strap (8) to the motor pump filter assembly (4). (5) Install the clamp (2) and hose (3) on the anti-siphon tube of the motor pump filter assembly (4). (6) Install the clamp (3) and hose (1) on the motor pump filter assembly (4). (7) Connect the timer water tank cable (11) to the motor pump filter assembly (4). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 400-002-A (1) Install the toilet shroud assembly ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400). SUBTASK 862-003-A (2) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the FLUSH circuit breaker (Location tip: DC BUS 1/LAVATORY/FLUSH) and close it. SUBTASK 610-003-A (3) Service the toilet unit (AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-801-A/300 or AMM TASK 38-30-00-600-802-A/300, as applicable). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 38-32-09 Page 6 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
